products.title: Kanchipuram Silk Saree
products.description: A premium handwoven silk saree known for its durability and richness.
products.history: Kanchipuram sarees are woven by artisans using pure mulberry silk and zari.

products.title: Ikat Dupatta
products.history: Ikat uses a resist-dyeing technique on warp and weft yarns.

products.title: Banarasi Silk Saree
products.description: Traditional Banarasi saree with intricate gold zari work.
products.history: Woven in Varanasi, these sarees were once made exclusively for royalty.

products.title: Jamdani Saree
products.description: Soft cotton Jamdani saree with geometric motifs.
products.history: Jamdani weaving is an ancient Bengali art form dating back to the Mughal era.

products.title: Muga Silk Fabric
products.description: Authentic Assam Muga silk, known for its natural golden luster.
products.history: Muga silk has been produced by Assamese weavers for centuries.

products.title: Kalamkari Dupatta
products.history: Kalamkari uses natural dyes and freehand painting techniques.

products.title: Bhagalpuri Tussar Silk
products.description: Lightweight Tussar silk known for its textured feel.
products.history: Bhagalpur is known as the ‘Silk City’ for its generations of weavers.

products.title: Ikkat Saree
products.description: Double Ikat saree featuring bold geometric patterns.
products.history: Double Ikat weaving requires months of preparation and precision.

products.title: Kota Doria Dupatta
products.description: Light, airy check-pattern dupatta woven on pit looms.
products.history: Kota Doria originates from Rajasthan and is known for its durability.

products.title: Handloom Cotton Saree
products.description: Soft breathable handloom cotton saree for everyday wear.
products.history: This weaving tradition has been passed down through generations.
